Package camzup.core

Class Face3

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Face3
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Face3>, java.lang.Iterable<Vert3>
public class Face3
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Vert3>, java.lang.Comparable<Face3>
Organizes components of a 3D mesh into a list of vertices that form a face. This is not used by a mesh internally; it is created upon retrieval from a mesh.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Face3.Vert3Iterator
    An iterator, which allows a face's vertices to be accessed in an enhanced for loop.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    Vert3[] vertices
    The array of vertices in a face.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Face3()
    The default constructor.
    Face3​(Vert3... vertices)
    Creates a face from an array of vertices.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static Vec3 centerMean​(Face3 face, Vec3 target)
    Finds the center of a face by averaging all the coordinates in its list of vertices.
    int compareTo​(Face3 face)
    Compares this face to another by hash code.
    boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
    Tests this face for equivalence with another object.

    Finds a point on the face's perimeter given a step in the range [0.0, 1.0] .

    Gets an edge from this face.

    Gets all the edges in this face.

    Returns a hash code for this face.

    int length()
    Returns the number of vertices in this face.
    static Vec3 normal​(Face3 face, Vec3 target)
    Finds the normal of a face by averaging all the normals in its list of vertices, then normalizing the average.
    static Quaternion orientation​(Face3 face, Handedness handedness, Quaternion target)
    Returns the orientation of the vertex as a quaternion based on the face's normal.
    static Transform3 orientation​(Face3 face, Handedness handedness, Transform3 target)
    Returns the orientation of the vertex as a transform based on the face's normal.
    static Ray3 orientation​(Face3 face, Ray3 target)
    Returns the orientation of the vertex as a ray based on the face's normal.
    static float perimeter​(Face3 face)
    Calculates the perimeter of a face by summing the Euclidean distance between vertices.
    Face3 rotate​(float radians, Vec3 axis)
    Rotates all coordinates in the mesh by an angle around an arbitrary axis.
    Face3 rotate​(Quaternion q)
    Rotates all coordinates in the face by a quaternion.

    Rotates all coordinates in the face by an angle around the x axis.
    Face3 rotateY​(float radians)
    Rotates all coordinates in the face by an angle around the y axis.
    Face3 rotateZ​(float radians)
    Rotates all coordinates in the face by an angle around the z axis.
    Face3 scale​(float scale)
    Scales all coordinates in the face by a scalar.
    Face3 scale​(Vec3 scale)
    Scales all coordinates in the face by a scalar.

    Beware, non-uniform scaling requires that normals be recalculated for correct shading.
    Face3 scaleGlobal​(float scale)
    Scales all coordinates in the face by a scalar; uses global coordinates, i.e., doesn't consider the face's position.
    Face3 scaleGlobal​(Vec3 scale)
    Scales all coordinates in the face by a scalar; uses global coordinates, i.e., doesn't consider the face's position.
    Face3 scaleLocal​(float scale)
    Scales all coordinates in the face by a scalar; subtracts the face's center from each vertex, scales, then adds the center.
    Face3 scaleLocal​(Vec3 scale)
    Scales all coordinates in the face by a scalar; subtracts the face's center from each vertex, scales, then adds the center.

    Beware, non-uniform scaling requires that normals be recalculated for correct shading.

    Returns a string representation of this face.

    Translates all coordinates in the face by a vector.

    • scale

      public Face3 scale​(Vec3 scale)
      Scales all coordinates in the face by a scalar.

      Beware, non-uniform scaling requires that normals be recalculated for correct shading.
      Parameters:
      scale - the nonuniform scalar
      Returns:
      this face
